bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Examination
Filed Oct. 13th, 69
Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla } SS
At Chambers, October 13th, 1869, before James K. Kennedy, Judge 1st judicial district.

James McAuliff, Sheriff of Walla Walla County makes affidavit filed therein charging John Suelling with committing the crime of Grand Larceny in Umatilla County, State of Oregon, in the latter part of the year 1868, and escaping from the County Jail, to which he had been committed, and that he was is a fugitive from justice, liable to be demanded by the Governor of Oregron, from the Governor of Washington Territory.
The defendand John Suelling was brought before me, and cautioned to say nothing to incriminate himself; his position was fully explained to him.
He then voluntarily stated that he had been committed to the jail of Umatilla County to answer the offense of larceny.
James McAuliff was then sworn, and testified as follows.

The prisoner, John Suelling,
voluntarily stated to me tha he broke out of the jail of Umatilla County, Oregon, by sawing his way out with a saw which some person from the outside had given him. The Sheriff of Umatilla County is now about to gone to get a requisition for hiim
Subscribed and sworn before me this 13th day of October 1869

Whereupon the prisoner was ordered to enter into recognizance, conditioned for his appearandce on or before the 31st day October 1869, to answer any demand that might be made for his body on a requisition, in the sum of five hundred dollars, or be committed in default, to the County Jail of Walla Walla County till said day.
In the matter of the Application of John Doe for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } In the Dist Court of teh 1st Jud Dist. Washington Territory in and for Walla Walla County
To the Hon Jas K. Kennedy Judge of said Court
The petition of John Doe respectfully shows

1st that he the said John Doe is unlawfully restrained of his liberty, is unlawfully confined imprisoned and detained by one James McAullif Sheriff of Walla Walla County W. T. and is now imprisoned and held by said McAuliff in the County Jail of Walla Walla County W. T.
That the said imprisonment detention confinement and restraint are illegal
3th That the affiants does not know of the cause of said restraint or illegality or pretenses for the same

That this petitioner was not convicted of any crimes or violation of the Statute of Washington Territory nor has he been arrested or committed by any committing magistrate for the same nor is he now held by any order of the Court or Committing magistrate of Washington Territory

Wherefore your petitioner pray that a
writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said James McAuliff Sheriff as aforesaid commanding him to have the body of Your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning your petitioner together with the time and cause of his detention and writ and that our petitioner may be restored to his liberty
Dated Oct. 13/69
div1.ab: L A Mullan & E. C. Ross atty for Petitioner
div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla

L. A. Mullan being first duly sworn says that he is atty of the petitioner named in the foregoing petition and that he knows the content named in of the foregoing petition and that the smae is true as he verily believes
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 13th day of Oct 1869
div1.ab: Chal W Frush Justice of Peace
div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla

To James McAuliff Sheriff of Walla Walla County you are hereby commanded to have the body of the within named John Doe before me at the Court House in Walla Walla at 3 o'closk of the afternoon of this the 13th day of October 1869 together with the cause of his detention of any you have
Witness my hand the day and Year above written
Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla

I R P Reynolds Clerk of the Dist Court of the 1st Jud Dist of Wash. Ter. do hereby certify that the foregoing is a true and correct transcript of the petition and prayer of John Doe and order order thereon
Witness my hand and that of said Court this 13th day of Oct. 1869
In the Matter of application of for a writ of Habeas Corpus
In Dist Court 1st Jud Dist
Filed Oct. 13th 69
Ross & Mullan Petitioner Attys
